intro: Xiphocarpus martinicensis, commonly known as the Martinique hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are palmately lobed and have a velvety texture, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain numerous seeds. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests.
